column4: Hello. Could anyone help me install the utilities necessary to build a custom kernel in Intrepid on a computer with no internet connection?
ubuntu does not support custom kernels, use a distro that does....
there are MANY issues that arrise with ubuntu + custom kernel
but essentially, all you need is gcc, ncurses and kernel source
Is that true? I have a book ("Practical Guide to Ubuntu") that has a whole chapter on it...
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Kernel/Compile
that is true, I have seen many people attempt it, it is possible but not supported or recommended
In a few words, why all the trouble?
I'm reading that link, by the way
ubuntu has implemented systems that install say, alsa modules via the package management system. On a modified ubuntu kernel you will not be able to install these modules the ubuntu way
I see. I guess that's the trade-off between ease of use and power/customizability
exactly
In that case, is it possible to easily build a module/driver for a new hardware item in ubuntu?
Any resources you could point me to for compiling a new kernel module/driver in ubuntu?
All I'm really after is gettin gmy ralink wireless card working :P
!wireless | The_Drizzle
Right on. Thanks for your help
that might require ndiswrapper, I don't know if it has native linux drivers
but ndiswrapper should always be a last resort
I think it does have native drivers since 2.6.26 or so
also, check the restricted driver manager
I just need to build it against the right kernel headers, right?
